listLimit.name: limit
listLimit.description: The number of results per page

listPage.name: page
listPage.description: Identifier of the page results to fetch.

listOrder.name: order
listOrder.description: An order for the items in the list

commentStatus.name: status
commentStatus.description: When provided, only comments with the given status are returned. Only "all" is supported for now.

spaceId.name: spaceId
spaceId.description: The unique id of the space

collectionId.name: collectionId
collectionId.description: The unique id of the collection

revisionId.name: revisionId
revisionId.description: The unique id of the revision

changeRequestId.description: The unique ID of the change request or its number identifier in the space

commentId.name: commentId
commentId.description: The unique id of the comment

commentReplyId.name: commentReplyId
commentReplyId.description: The unique id of the comment reply

integrationName.name: integrationName
integrationName.description: Name of the integration. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, -, _, .

organizationId.name: organizationId
organizationId.description: The unique id of the organization

captureId.name: captureId
captureId.description: The unique id of a capture

userId.name: userId
userId.description: The unique ID of the User

teamId.name: teamId
teamId.description: The unique ID of the Team

pageId.name: pageId
pageId.description: The unique id of the page

pagePath.name: pagePath
pagePath.description: The path of the page in the revision.

entityId.name: entityId
entityId.description: ID of the entity in the space

page.description: Unique identifier to query the next results page

count.description: Total count of objects in the list

Emoji.description: Unicode codepoint or character of the emoji

EmojiReaction.description: An emoji reaction by one or many users

count.description: The number of users who reacted with this emoji

users.description: The users who reacted with this emoji

visitor.description: Analytics info on the GitBook's content visitor.

anonymousId.description: GitBook's unique identifier of the visitor.

url.description: The GitBook content's URL visited (including URL params).

referrer.description: The URL of referrer that linked to the page.

target.description: Allowed installation target for the integration. If not specified, the integration can be installed at `all` targets (org, spaces etc)

script.description: Content of the script to use

organization.description: The ID or subdomain of the organization under which the integration should be published

reason.description: Reason that triggered the billing upgrade

mode.description: Mode to use for the upgrade (default value is `commit`): - `auto`: user is redirect to checkout if possible, other a preview of the auto-upgrade is returned. - `commit`: a checkout session is returned or an auto-upgrade is done - `preview`: a preview invoice is always returned

oneOf.description: The email address of the user to invite as a member

email.description: The email address of the user to invite as a member

role.description: Default role to set on newly invited members.

sso.description: If true, invites the user as an SSO user of the organization. Defaults to false.

url.description: URL of the Git repository to import. It can contain basic auth credentials.

ref.description: Git ref to import in the format "refs/heads/main"

repoCacheID.description: Unique identifier to use to cache the Git repository across multiple operations.

repoTreeURL.description: URL to use as a prefix for external file references.

repoCommitURL.description: URL to use as a prefix for the commit URL.

repoProjectDirectory.description: Path to a root directory for the project in the repository.

standalone.description: If true, the import will generate a revision without updating the space primary content.

gitInfo.description: Optional metadata to store on the space about the Git provider

url.description: URL of the Git repository to export to. It can contain basic auth credentials.

ref.description: Git ref to push the commit to in the format "refs/heads/main"

commitMessage.description: Message for the commit generated by the export

repoCacheID.description: Unique identifier to use to cache the Git repository across multiple operations.

repoTreeURL.description: URL to use as a prefix for external file references.

repoCommitURL.description: URL to use as a prefix for the commit URL.

repoProjectDirectory.description: Path to a root directory for the project in the repository.

gitInfo.description: Optional metadata to store on the space about the Git provider

url.description: URL of the content to import.

private.description: Private spaces are no longer supported by GitBook.

componentId.description: ID of the component to render in the integration.

state.description: Current local state of the UI.

fallbackURL.description: A fallback URL that will be used if authentication fails.

RequestUpdateSpaceGitInfo.description: Update metadata about the Git provider on the space

build.description: Date of the latest release in ISO format

RequestPurgeCDNCacheContext.description: The context to send when purging the CDN Cache

values.description: The list of tags or hosts to purge

RequestBlockUserContext.description: The context to send when blocking/unblocking a user

TriggerContentIndexingContext.description: The context to send when triggering a content indexing.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the Space to index.

force.description: Whether to force a complete re-indexing of the Space.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "user"

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture

location.description: URL of the user in the API

UserAPIToken.description: The API token details, excluding the token itself.

UserAPITokenExtended.description: The API token details, including the token itself.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "team"

ContentVisibility.description:
* `public`: Anyone can access the content, and the content is indexed by search engines.
* `unlisted`: Anyone can access the content, and the content is not indexed by search engines
* `share-link`: Anyone with a secret token in the url can access the content.
* `visitor-auth`: Anyone authenticated through a JWT token can access the content.
* `in-collection`: Anyone who can access the parent collection can access the content.
  Only available for spaces in a collection.
* `private`: Authorized members can access the content.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "publishing-auth"

privateKey.description: Private key used to sign JWT tokens.

fallbackURL.description: URL to redirect to when the visitor auth secret is invalid.

revision.description: ID of the newly created revision.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "comment"

postedBy.description: The user who posted the comment.

editedAt.description: Date when the comment was edited, if it has been edited.

reactions.description: Any emoji reactions to the comment.

replies.description: The number of replies to this comment.

target.description: Information about the target of the comment.

node.description: The node this comment is attached to.

changeRequest.description: The change request containing this comment, if the comment was made inside a change request.

review.description: The review containing this comment, if this comment was made as part of a review.

page.description: Information about the page, if this comment refers to a specific page.

path.description: The fully qualified path to the page

outdated.description: True if the target of this comment no longer exists in the primary content

revision.description: The revision in which the target can be found in.

location.description: URL of the comment in the API

resolvedAt.description: If the comment has been resolved, the date at which it was resolved. If this field is not defined, the comment is not resolved.

resolvedBy.description: If the comment has been resolved, the user who resolved it. If this field is not defined, the comment is not resolved.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "comment-reply"

editedAt.description: Date when the reply was edited, if it has been edited.

location.description: URL of the comment reply in the API

markdown.description: Content of the document formatted as markdown

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "space"

location.description: URL of the space in the API

app.description: URL of the space in the application

published.description: URL of the published version of the space. Only defined when visibility is not "private."

public.description: URL of the public version of the space. Only defined when visibility is "public".

organization.description: ID of the organization owning this space

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "revision"

git.description: Metadata about a potential associated git commit.

createdByGitBook.description: Whether not this commit was created by GitBook, while exporting the revision.

app.description: URL in the application for the revision

published.description: URL of the published version of the revision. Only defined when the space visibility is not "private."

public.description: URL of the public version of the revision. Only defined when the space visibility is "public".

type.description: Revision created when merging a change request with primary.
Revision created as a rollback of a previous revision.
Revision created when updating a change request with changes from primary.
Revision created by editing the content.

id.description: Unique identifier for the page in the revision

slug.description: Page's slug in its direct parent

path.description: Complete path to access the page in the revision.

slug.description: Page's slug in its direct parent

path.description: Complete path to access the page in the revision.

installationProvider.description: The provider of the Git Sync installation.

url.description: The URL to the repository tree, used when rendering public content.

updatedAt.description: When the Git provider details were last updated

completedAt.description: Date when the operation was successful (when state is `success`)

error.description: Error details, defined if state is `failure`.

GitSyncOperationState.description:
* `running`: The operation is still running
* `failure`: The operation failed
* `success`: The operation was successful

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "organization"

location.description: URL of the organization in the API

app.description: URL of the organization in the application

MemberRole.description:
"The role of a member in an organization.
"admin": Can administrate the content: create, delete spaces, ...
"create": Can create content.
"review": Can review content.
"edit": Can edit the content (live or change requests).
"comment": Can access the content and its discussions.
"read": Can access the content, but cannot update it in any way.

MemberRoleOrGuest.description: The role of a member in an organization, null for guests

collection.description: The unique id of the collection created in the target organization containing the content of the source organization.

newSourceHostname.description: The new hostname if the source organization needed to change hostname.

id.description: The unique identifier of this group in WorkOS. Not the unique ID from GitBook.

idp_id.description: The identity provider's unique ID for this group, should be used to generate the team's unique ID when syncing the groups.

directory_id.description: The unique ID of the directory this group is owned by in WorkOS. Is not a unique ID from our database.

name.description: The name of the group from the identity provider, it should always be set according to the WorkOS documentation.

teamKey.description: The unique ID of the GitBook team already synced to this group, if applicable.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "member"

disabled.description: Whatever the membership of this user is disabled and prevent them from accessing content.

joinedAt.description: Date at which the user joined the organization.

lastSeenAt.description: Date at which the user was last seen active in the organization.

sso.description: Whether the user can login with SSO.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "team"

members.description: Count of members in this team.

spaces.description: Count of spaces this team has access to.

createdAt.description: Date at which the team was created.

TeamMemberRole.description:
"The role of a team member.
"owner": Can manage team members.
"member": Is a member of the team.

OrganizationTeamMember.description: A member of a team in an organization, including its relationship to it

externalId.description: ID in the original source of the capture.

externalURL.description: URL of the source from which the capture originated

contributors.description: An array of contributors to the capture. The first contributor is the one who triggered the capture (either a user or an integration).

output.description: Output document for the capture. Is not set when capture is not finished.

location.description: URL of the capture in the API

app.description: URL of the capture in the app

source.description: Optionally, provide the source of the event. GitBook may use this to improve the generated content.

actor.description: Optionally, provide the actor of the event, in the context of multiple people contributing to the capture.

audio.description: WAV audio file, encoded as base64

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "change-request"

id.description: Unique identifier for the change request

number.description: Incremental identifier of the change request

app.description: URL of the space in the application

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "change-request-review"

revision.description: The revision this review was made against.

reviewer.description: The user who performed the review.

requestedBy.description: The user who requested the review. If undefined, the review was left without a request.

ChangeRequestReviewStatus.description: Status of a change request review.

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "change-request-requested-reviewer"

revision.description: The revision of the content when the request was made.

requestedBy.description: The user who made the request.

user.description: The user who was requested to review.

team.description: The team who was requested to review.

resolved.description: Whether the comment is resolved or not.

addedReactions.description: Reactions to add to the comment.

removedReactions.description: Reactions to remove from the comment.

addedReactions.description: Reactions to add to the comment.

removedReactions.description: Reactions to remove from the comment.

node.description: The node to which the comment is posted, if any.

page.description: The page to which the comment is posted, if any.

UserContentPermission.description: Permission of a user in a content.

MemberContentPermission.description: Permission of a member in a content.

SearchPageResult.description: Search result representing a page in a space.

app.description: URL of the page in the application

SearchSectionResult.description: Search result representing a section in a page.

app.description: URL of the section in the application

SearchAIAnswer.description: Answer from AI for a question asked on a content.

sources.description: The sources used to generate the answer.

pages.description: The pages used to generate the answer. Deprecated - use sources instead.

integration.description: The name of the integration that manages this entity. If undefined, this entity is not managed by an integration.

SearchAIRecommendedQuestions.description: Questions recommended by the AI for the given content.

AnalyticsSearchQuery.description: Analytics entry for a search query.

searches.description: Number of searches done by users.

hits.description: Number of objects matching this search.

pageHits.description: Number of pages matching this search.

sectionHits.description: Number of sections matching this search.

searches.description: Number of searches done by users.

queries.description: Top queries searched for this content.

count.description: Total number of page views over the period.

views.description: Page views per interval (day, week, month).

object.description: Type of Object, always equals to "collection"

primarySpace.description: ID of the primary space for this collection

collection.description: ID of the parent collection, if any

name.description: Unique named identifier for the integration

verified.description: If true, the integration has been verified by the GitBook team

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the integration

installationId.description: Unique ID of the integration installation.

message.description: The message of the log entry.

level.description: The level of the log entry.

IntegrationInstallationSpaceSelection.description: Describe whether all spaces have been selected or there's a selection involved

spaces.description: Count of spaces, the installation is managing

integration.description: Unique name identifier of the integration

space.description: ID of the space the integration is installed on.

configuration.description: Configuration of the integration for this space

publicEndpoint.description: Public HTTP endpoint for the integration's space installation

IntegrationSecrets.description: Secrets stored on the integration and passed at runtime.

IntegrationEnvironment.description: Runtime environment provided during the execution of integration's code.

authToken.description: Authentication token to use with the HTTP API. Depending on the context, the token might be representing the installation or the integration.

signingSecret.description: Secret that can be used to verify the authenticity of incoming HTTP requests to the integration.

integration.description: API authentication token representing the integration.

installation.description: API authentication token representing the current installation.

Security policy to validate the content of the integrations scripts and Contentkit. Will be sent as 
headers when processing the script fetch event and the blocks fetch events.

name.description: Unique named identifier for the integration

properties.description: Map of values stored as properties on the entity

id.description: Unique ID for the entity in GitBook

type.description: Type of an entity. Deprecated, use entityType.

deprecated.description: If true, the property is no longer required and not taken into consideration

oneOf.description: reference to another entity, creating a relation

Event generated when rendering a UI

url.description: URL to the billing portal for an organization

amountDueToday.description: Amount that will be immediately charged.

customerBalance.description: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If positive, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice.

lines.description: Details of the change happening on the subscription.

CloudflareHostnameTLSValidationError.description: The Cloudflare Hostname TLS validation error

CloudflareHostnameTLSValidationMethod.description: The Cloudflare Hostname TLS validation method

PurgeCDNCacheContextType.description: The type of purge, e.g by tags or hosts

UserBackOfficeInfo.description: The GitBook User info shown in the BackOffice.

UserImpersonation.description: The info returned when impersonating a GitBook User.

wasRisky.description: True if the user was originally considered as risky

isRisky.description: True if the user is currently considered as risky

isVerified.description: True if the user went through the verification process

completedSteps.description: Number of verification steps completed by the user

expectedSteps.description: Total number of verification steps expected

googleLogin.description: User completed the Google Account verification step

githubLogin.description: User completed the GitHub Account verification step

emailVerified.description: User completed the Email verification step

HiveAccessToken.description: JWT tokens to authenticate in Hive for all content.

token.description: Temporary access token to authenticate with the API

ContentKitContext.description: Object representing the context in which a ContentKit component is rendered.

allOf.description: Context while rendering in an account installation's configuration.

organizationId.description: ID of the organization the account installation configuration is in.

allOf.description: Context while rendering in a space-installation's configuration.

spaceId.description: ID of the space the space-installation configuration is in.

allOf.description: Context while rendering in a document.

spaceId.description: ID of the space content the document is in.

ContentKitDynamicBinding.description: Binding between a property and a state value.

ContentKitBlock.description: Higher level element to represent a custom block.

ContentKitBlockControl.description: Control menu item displayed for the block.

ContentKitTextInput.description: Text input to prompt the user.

state.description: State binding. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

initialValue.description: Text value to initialize the input with.

placeholder.description: Text that appears in the form control when it has no value set

grow.description: specifies how much of the remaining space in the container should be assigned to the element

ContentKitHint.description: Element used to contextualize other elements or info.

ContentKitDivider.description: Divider between 2 boxes in a stack.

anyOf.description: Custom action to re-render the block.

oneOf.description: Action to open an overlay modal defined by "componentId".
Action when a modal overlay is closed, with a return value to the higher level component in the stack. This action will be triggered on the parent component instance.
Action when a link is being unfurled into a block.
Action to update the properties stored in the related node.

returnValue.description: Data passed back to the parent view when the modal is closed. These data are accessible in the "@ui.modal.close"

aspectRatio.description: Ratio between width and height. Used to size the webframe.

source.description: Content to load in the frame.

buttons.description: Controls button shown as an overlay in a corner of the frame.

data.description: Data to communicated to the webframe's content. Each state update will cause the webframe to receive a message.

syntax.description: Syntax to use for highlighting (ex: javascript, python)

buttons.description: Controls button shown as an overlay in a corner of the code block.

state.description: State binding when editable. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

header.description: Header displayed before the code lines

footer.description: Footer displayed after the code lines

ContentKitRenderOutput.description: Output of the integration when rendering an UI.

ContentKitMarkdown.description: Block with rich text formatting of a markdown content.

buttons.description: Buttons displayed in the top right corner of the card.

label.description: Text label displayed next to the input.

ContentKitSelectOption.description: An individual option in a select element

ContentKitSelect.description: Creates a drop down menu with a list of options for a user to choose.

state.description: State binding. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

initialValue.description: Value to initialize the select with.

placeholder.description: Text that appears in the form control when it has no value set

multiple.description: Should the select accept the selection of multiple options. If true, the state will be an array.

acceptInput.description: Should the filter input be allowed to be selected as an option.

options.description: Array of options to display in the select.

oneOf.description: External source of options. The URL should respond with an array of options.

state.description: State binding. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

initialValue.description: Value to initialize the switch with.

state.description: State binding. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

value.description: Value to store in a state array when the checkbox is selected.

state.description: State binding. The value of the input will be stored as a property in the state named after this ID.

value.description: Value to store in th state when the checkbox is selected.

ContentKitConfirm.description: A confirm object that defines an optional confirmation dialog after the input is clicked.

title.description: A text value that defines the dialog's title.

text.description: A text value that defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog.

confirm.description: A text value to define the text of the button that confirms the action.

ContentKitDescendantElement.description: Any element that can be used as children.

ContentKitURL.description: Specification for an URL in ContentKit.

host.description: Hostname of the URL along with the port number if required.

pathname.description: Path of the URL prefixed with a `/`.

source.description: The unique id of the organization to transfer into the current one.

defaultOrgRole.description: Determine the default role members of the source org will have when they are transferred into the target org. Defaults to null, which means no access.

oneOf.description: Use SAML's default role for transferred members.

collection.description: The unique id of the collection created in the target organization containing the content of the source organization.

newSourceHostname.description: The new hostname if the source organization needed to change hostname.

post.summary: Set up Directory Sync in an organization.

200.description: Directory Sync has been properly initialized for the organization.

setupUrl.description: The URL to navigate to to continue Directory Sync setup.

get.summary: Lists the groups exposed to the synced Directory on an organization.

200.description:
A list of all of a Directory's group configured for the given identity provider.
Only groups pushed to the SCIM sync will be listed in this result.

post.summary: Syncs a list of group/team unique identifiers pairs together.
post.description:
Each pair will lead the team being synced to the group (unless it is already synced to another) and the members of the group will then be synced to the team.
Each sync is independent, the endpoint will still succeed if some of the syncs fail.
Check the response to know more about the success or failure of the entire sync.

schema.description:
Parameters for syncing a list of Directory Sync groups to a GitBook team, syncing all members of those groups to the assigned teams.
The endpoint can be used for one or many groups to team syncs.

to_sync.description:
A list of groups to teams pairs to sync.
The group_id is required and the team_id is optional.
If the latter is omitted, a new team will be created from the group's data.

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group for the given identity provider.

team_id.description: The unique identifier of the team for the given identity provider.

200.description:
A list of the results of the synchronization.
This will return regardless of the status of the sync.
Check the content to know if the sync was successful.

synced.description:
The list of synced pairs, mapped to the original pairs given to the sync parameters.
Either the group_id and team_id will be defined, or the error will be defined to describe why it failed.
Use the success parameter to know if the pair sync was sucessful or not.
